conclusion: The problem involves a graph representing position over time for a vehicle, plotted as x/t versus t.
The horizontal axis is time in seconds, and the vertical axis is x/t in meters per second. A straight line starts at t = -2 s and x/t = 0 m/s, intersecting the y-axis at t = 0 s and x/t = 10 m/s.
Time can't be negative in reality, so focus on t >= 0 s.
At t = 0 s, x/t = 10 m/s implies x = 0 m.
As time increases, x/t increases linearly with t.
Derive an expression for x in terms of t: x/t = mt + b, with b = 10 m/s.
Calculate slope m of the x/t versus t graph: m = 5 m/s².
Verify x/t = (5t² + 10t)/t = 5t + 10 matches x/t = mt + b.
